results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.

results.title: Gladiator [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, NBCUniversal, Douglas Wick, David Franzoni, Branko Lustig and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Russell Crowe stars as Maximus, a former general accused of murdering Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Maximus is forced to become a gladiator, and uses his newfound fame and power to extract revenge.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, NBCUniversal, Douglas Wick, David Franzoni, Branko Lustig and Ridley Scott
results.description: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. As a result of his accusation, Maximus is stripped of his title and position in the army and sold to slave traders, forced to become a gladiator - men trained to fight to the death as entertainment for a paying audience. Using his new fame and power he vows to fight the man responsible for his dishonour. Includes the making of documentary. Cast also includes Connie Nielsen, Derek Jacobi, Richard Harris and Oliver Reed in his final screen role (Reed died before the movie was completed). Awards: winner of 5 Academy Awards including Best Actor (Russell Crowe) and Best Film (2000).
description_for_label: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. Using his new fame and power he vows to fight the man responsible for his dishonour. Includes the making of documentary. Cast also includes Connie Nielsen, Derek Jacobi, Richard Harris and Oliver Reed in his final screen role (Reed died before the movie was completed). Awards: winner of 5 Academy Awards including Best Actor (Russell Crowe) and Best Film (2000).

results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Edward Lewis, Universal Pictures, Bryna Productions and Stanley Kubrick
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Lewis, Universal Pictures, Bryna Productions and Stanley Kubrick
results.description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.
description_for_label: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.

results.title: La Vie a L'envers = Life Upside Down
results.brief_description:
An ordinary young Paris office worker suddenly decides to retreat into his own inner world, giving up his loquacious new wife, his friends, work and possessions. He ends up contentedly staring at a blank wall in the bare room of mental clinic. The theme of alienation, a prevalent one in the 1960s, has seldom been explored with such wry wit and sensitivity, although the film’s attitude to its hero remains ambiguous. Awards: Cannes Festival (1964): Critics’ Week Prize ; Venice Film Festival (1964): Prize for the First Work. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Alain Jessua ; writer, Alain Jessua ; photography, Jacques Robin ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Charles Denner, Anna Gaylor, Jean Yanne, Yvonne Clech, Robert Bousquet, Nicole Gueden, Guy Saint-Jean, Francois Moncey, Jean Dewewer.

results.title: Mayes C Rubeo
results.brief_description: Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to MCU, having worked on WandaVision and Thor: Ragnarok before Thor: Love and Thunder, but her costume design credentials include some of the biggest blockbusters.

constellations_primary.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_primary.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

results.description:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”
description_for_label:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”

results.title: Sex, guys and videotape
results.creator_credit: Martin Coombes, Mark Fitzgerald and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Elle McFeast (aka Lisbeth Gorr) presents this celebration of male sexuality with some of Australia’s pre-eminent males; Nick Giannopoulos, Greg Chappell, Lex Marinos, Mikey Robins, Hung Le, Rex Mossop, Mike Whitney, Ian Rogerson, Damien Lovelock, the Oarsome Foursome, Doug Mulray, Neil Murray, Piet Collins, Darren Baxter, Paul Hudson and Clive Robertson. Collectively, they discuss issues such as whether size really matters, self control, naming conventions, how they learnt about sex, the first time, condom wearing and what it feels like, what makes for sensational sex, performance anxiety and one night stands. Judith Lucy and Deborah Conway also contribute.
